Why great issues and pull requests are critical

Even in an AI‚Äëaccelerated workflow, these two artifacts are how present and future teams understand what happened and why.

  • Shared context: One URL captures the problem statement, reproduction steps, and definition of done. Anyone joining next week‚Äîor next year‚Äîcan catch up in minutes. And as we say at GitHub, if it doesn‚Äôt have a URL it didn‚Äôt happen.¬†
  • Async coordination: Whether teams are working across timezones, or simply looking to stay heads-down, meetings often add complexity and overhead. Issues free up time by letting developers work asynchronously, meeting only when it will add value.¬†

Miss the structure and every downstream step‚Äîhuman or AI‚Äîslows down. Need an example? Here‚Äôs an issue I‚Äôve been looking at today (and no, I‚Äôm not going to name and shame anyone):

Issue #12609: Found broken link. Please fix!

As developers, we need well-crafted issues in order to dive into any project we get asked to do, and we need to write good issues to help teammates work effectively. AI is no exception: Large language models perform best when objectives, constraints, and success criteria are explicit. A vague prompt leads to vague output, whether it‚Äôs created by a human or a machine.

Here‚Äôs the thing: By allowing Copilot to assist with issue creation, you get to focus on clarity, not copy pasting, as Copilot locates the relevant references, builds out the initial issue structure, and even adds labels or project assignments.

The anatomy of a great GitHub Issue

  • Action‚Äëforward title: Lead with the noun and follow with the verb: ‚ÄúLogin button ‚Äì disable on Safari‚ÄØ17 beta‚Äù beats ‚ÄúSome login thing?‚Äù

Miss anything and async breaks down. Nail this format and Copilot‚Äîand your team‚Äîcan move fast.

How to draft issues on GitHub faster with Copilot

Great issues share two traits: they‚Äôre fast to write and rich in context. GitHub‚ÄØCopilot‚Äôs Create Issue flow gives you both. Instead of hopping between fields or copy‚Äëpasting snippets, you can open Copilot Chat and describe the problem in plain language:¬†

  • Open Copilot Chat‚Äôs immersive view at github.com/copilot.

Tips for building great issues with GitHub Copilot

How to turn an issue into a draft PR with the coding agent in GitHub Copilot¬†

Ok‚Äînow that you have a clear issue in hand thanks to Copilot,¬† you can assign it to Copilot via the coding agent (yes, it shows up like any teammate) or ask:

  • ‚ÄúMobile support?‚Äù

Next time your brain yells ‚ÄúUgh, filing this bug will take longer than fixing it,‚Äù open Copilot Chat and let the robot handle the form fields while you capture intent. The faster you translate thought to issue to PR, the sooner users get features‚Äîand the sooner you get back to the fun bits.
